Control Long Name: ID.AM-1: Physical devices and systems within the organization are inventoried
Control Description: Physical devices and systems within the organization are inventoried

Control Long Name: ID.AM-2: Software platforms and applications within the organization are inventoried
Control Description: Software platforms and applications within the organization are inventoried

Control Long Name: ID.AM-3: Organizational communication and data flows are mapped
Control Description: Organizational communication and data flows are mapped

Control Long Name: ID.AM-4: External information systems are catalogued
Control Description: External information systems are catalogued

Control Long Name: ID.AM-5: Resources (e.g., hardware, devices, data, time, personnel, and software) are prioritized based on their classification, criticality, and business value
Control Description: Resources (e.g., hardware, devices, data, time, personnel, and software) are prioritized based on their classification, criticality, and business value

Control Long Name: ID.AM-6: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for the entire workforce and third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) are established
Control Description: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for the entire workforce and third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) are established

Control Long Name: ID.BE-1: The organization’s role in the supply chain is identified and communicated
Control Description: The organization’s role in the supply chain is identified and communicated

Control Long Name: ID.BE-2: The organization’s place in critical infrastructure and its industry sector is identified and communicated
Control Description: The organization’s place in critical infrastructure and its industry sector is identified and communicated

Control Long Name: ID.BE-3: Priorities for organizational mission, objectives, and activities are established and communicated
Control Description: Priorities for organizational mission, objectives, and activities are established and communicated

Control Long Name: ID.BE-4: Dependencies and critical functions for delivery of critical services are established
Control Description: Dependencies and critical functions for delivery of critical services are established

Control Long Name: ID.BE-5: Resilience requirements to support delivery of critical services are established for all operating states (e.g. under duress/attack, during recovery, normal operations)
Control Description: Resilience requirements to support delivery of critical services are established for all operating states (e.g. under duress/attack, during recovery, normal operations)

Control Long Name: ID.GV-1: Organizational cybersecurity policy is established and communicated
Control Description: Organizational cybersecurity policy is established and communicated

Control Long Name: ID.GV-2: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are coordinated and aligned with internal roles and external partners
Control Description: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are coordinated and aligned with internal roles and external partners

Control Long Name: ID.GV-3: Legal and regulatory requirements regarding cybersecurity, including privacy and civil liberties obligations, are understood and managed
Control Description: Legal and regulatory requirements regarding cybersecurity, including privacy and civil liberties obligations, are understood and managed

Control Long Name: ID.GV-4: Governance and risk management processes address cybersecurity risks
Control Description: Governance and risk management processes address cybersecurity risks

Control Long Name: ID.RA-1: Asset vulnerabilities are identified and documented
Control Description: Asset vulnerabilities are identified and documented

Control Long Name: ID.RA-2: Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources
Control Description: Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources

Control Long Name: ID.RA-3: Threats, both internal and external, are identified and documented
Control Description: Threats, both internal and external, are identified and documented

Control Long Name: ID.RA-4: Potential business impacts and likelihoods are identified
Control Description: Potential business impacts and likelihoods are identified

Control Long Name: ID.RA-5: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to determine risk
Control Description: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to determine risk

Control Long Name: ID.RA-6: Risk responses are identified and prioritized
Control Description: Risk responses are identified and prioritized

Control Long Name: ID.RM-1: Risk management processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders
Control Description: Risk management processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders

Control Long Name: ID.RM-2: Organizational risk tolerance is determined and clearly expressed
Control Description: Organizational risk tolerance is determined and clearly expressed

Control Long Name: ID.RM-3: The organization’s determination of risk tolerance is informed by its role in critical infrastructure and sector specific risk analysis
Control Description: The organization’s determination of risk tolerance is informed by its role in critical infrastructure and sector specific risk analysis

Control Long Name: ID.SC-1: Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, assessed, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders
Control Description: Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, assessed, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders

Control Long Name: ID.SC-2: Suppliers and third party partners of information systems, components, and services are identified, prioritized, and assessed using a cyber supply chain risk assessment process
Control Description: Suppliers and third party partners of information systems, components, and services are identified, prioritized, and assessed using a cyber supply chain risk assessment process

Control Long Name: ID.SC-3: Contracts with suppliers and third-party partners are used to implement appropriate measures designed to meet the objectives of an organization’s cybersecurity program and Cyber Supply Chain Risk Management Plan.
Control Description: Contracts with suppliers and third-party partners are used to implement appropriate measures designed to meet the objectives of an organization’s cybersecurity program and Cyber Supply Chain Risk Management Plan.

Control Long Name: ID.SC-4: Suppliers and third-party partners are routinely assessed using audits, test results, or other forms of evaluations to confirm they are meeting their contractual obligations.
Control Description: Suppliers and third-party partners are routinely assessed using audits, test results, or other forms of evaluations to confirm they are meeting their contractual obligations.

Control Long Name: ID.SC-5: Response and recovery planning and testing are conducted with suppliers and third-party providers
Control Description: Response and recovery planning and testing are conducted with suppliers and third-party providers

Control Long Name: PR.AC-1: Identities and credentials are issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited for authorized devices, users and processes
Control Description: Identities and credentials are issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited for authorized devices, users and processes
Control Family: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR.AC)

Control Long Name: PR.AC-2: Physical access to assets is managed and protected
Control Description: Physical access to assets is managed and protected
Control Family: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR.AC)

Control Long Name: PR.AC-3: Remote access is managed
Control Description: Remote access is managed
Control Family: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR.AC)

Control Long Name: PR.AC-4: Access permissions and authorizations are managed, incorporating the principles of least privilege and separation of duties
Control Description: Access permissions and authorizations are managed, incorporating the principles of least privilege and separation of duties
Control Family: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR.AC)

Control Long Name: PR.AC-5: Network integrity is protected (e.g., network segregation, network segmentation)
Control Description: Network integrity is protected (e.g., network segregation, network segmentation)
Control Family: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR.AC)

Control Long Name: PR.AC-6: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials and asserted in interactions
Control Description: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials and asserted in interactions
Control Family: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR.AC)

Control Long Name: PR.AC-7: Users, devices, and other assets are authenticated (e.g., single-factor, multi-factor) commensurate with the risk of the transaction (e.g., individuals’ security and privacy risks and other organizational risks)
Control Description: Users, devices, and other assets are authenticated (e.g., single-factor, multi-factor) commensurate with the risk of the transaction (e.g., individuals’ security and privacy risks and other organizational risks)
Control Family: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control (PR.AC)

Control Description: All users are informed and trained

Control Long Name: PR.AT-2: Privileged users understand their roles and responsibilities
Control Description: Privileged users understand their roles and responsibilities

Control Long Name: PR.AT-3: Third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) understand their roles and responsibilities
Control Description: Third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) understand their roles and responsibilities

Control Description: Senior executives understand their roles and responsibilities

Control Long Name: PR.AT-5: Physical and cybersecurity personnel understand their roles and responsibilities
Control Description: Physical and cybersecurity personnel understand their roles and responsibilities

Control Long Name: PR.DS-1: Data-at-rest is protected
Control Description: Data-at-rest is protected

Control Description: Data-in-transit is protected

Control Long Name: PR.DS-3: Assets are formally managed throughout removal, transfers, and disposition
Control Description: Assets are formally managed throughout removal, transfers, and disposition

Control Description: Adequate capacity to ensure availability is maintained

Control Description: Protections against data leaks are implemented

Control Description: Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify software, firmware, and information integrity

Control Description: The development and testing environment(s) are separate from the production environment

Control Long Name: PR.DS-8: Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify hardware integrity
Control Description: Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify hardware integrity

Control Description: A baseline configuration of information technology/industrial control systems is created and maintained incorporating security principles (e.g. concept of least functionality)

Control Long Name: PR.IP-2: A System Development Life Cycle to manage systems is implemented
Control Description: A System Development Life Cycle to manage systems is implemented

Control Long Name: PR.IP-3: Configuration change control processes are in place
Control Description: Configuration change control processes are in place

Control Description: Backups of information are conducted, maintained, and tested

Control Long Name: PR.IP-5: Policy and regulations regarding the physical operating environment for organizational assets are met
Control Description: Policy and regulations regarding the physical operating environment for organizational assets are met

Control Long Name: PR.IP-6: Data is destroyed according to policy
Control Description: Data is destroyed according to policy

Control Long Name: PR.IP-7: Protection processes are improved
Control Description: Protection processes are improved

Control Long Name: PR.IP-8: Effectiveness of protection technologies is shared
Control Description: Effectiveness of protection technologies is shared

Control Description: Response plans (Incident Response and Business Continuity) and recovery plans (Incident Recovery and Disaster Recovery) are in place and managed

Control Description: Response and recovery plans are tested

Control Description: Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices (e.g., deprovisioning, personnel screening)

Control Description: A vulnerability management plan is developed and implemented

Control Description: Maintenance and repair of organizational assets are performed and logged, with approved and controlled tools

Control Description: Remote maintenance of organizational assets is approved, logged, and performed in a manner that prevents unauthorized access

Control Description: Audit/log records are determined, documented, implemented, and reviewed in accordance with policy

Control Description: Removable media is protected and its use restricted according to policy

Control Description: The principle of least functionality is incorporated by configuring systems to provide only essential capabilities

Control Description: Communications and control networks are protected

Control Description: Mechanisms (e.g., failsafe, load balancing, hot swap) are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations

Control Description: A baseline of network operations and expected data flows for users and systems is established and managed

Control Description: Detected events are analyzed to understand attack targets and methods

Control Description: Event data are collected and correlated from multiple sources and sensors

Control Description: Impact of events is determined

Control Description: Incident alert thresholds are established

Control Description: Personnel activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

Control Description: Response plan is executed during or after an incident

Control Description: Personnel know their roles and order of operations when a response is needed

Control Description: Incidents are reported consistent with established criteria

Control Description: Incidents are categorized consistent with response plans
